entry.title: FlowSync Launches v2.0: A Complete Redesign
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce FlowSync v2.0, the biggest update since our launch. After months of user research, prototyping, and engineering work, we've rebuilt the entire platform from the ground up.

What's New

Redesigned Interface

The new UI is cleaner, faster, and more intuitive. We've reduced click paths by 40% for common actions and introduced a unified command palette for power users.

Real-time Collaboration

Multiple team members can now edit the same board simultaneously. You'll see cursors, selections, and changes in real-time — just like Google Docs, but for project management.

Performance

The entire frontend has been rebuilt with modern tooling:

  • 60% faster initial page load
  • 3x faster search across large workspaces
  • Offline mode with automatic sync when back online

Migration

Existing users will be automatically migrated to v2.0 over the next two weeks. No action is required — all your data, integrations, and settings will be preserved.

What's Next

We're already working on v2.1, which will include:

  • AI-powered task suggestions
  • Advanced automation workflows
  • Native mobile app refresh

Thanks to everyone who participated in our beta program. Your feedback shaped every pixel of this release.

entry.title: 5 Strategies for Remote Team Productivity
entry.content:
Managing a remote team is more than just moving meetings to video calls. After working with thousands of distributed teams, we've identified the strategies that actually move the needle.

1. Async-First Communication

Not every conversation needs to happen in real-time. Encourage your team to default to written updates, recorded demos, and threaded discussions. Reserve synchronous time for brainstorming and relationship building.

2. Clear Ownership

Every task, project, and decision should have a single owner. This doesn't mean working alone — it means someone is responsible for driving progress and communicating status.

3. Visible Work

When you can't see your colleagues at their desks, work needs to be visible in other ways. Use shared boards, daily standups (async or sync), and progress dashboards to keep everyone informed.

4. Time Zone Awareness

Overlapping hours are precious. Use them for collaborative work and meetings. Use non-overlapping hours for deep focus work. Document decisions so no one wakes up confused.

5. Intentional Culture

Remote culture doesn't happen by accident. Schedule virtual social events, celebrate wins publicly, and create spaces for non-work conversations.

FlowSync's async features — comment threads, recorded updates, and timezone-aware scheduling — are designed to support these strategies out of the box.

entry.title: New Integrations: GitHub, Linear, and Notion
entry.content:
We've just shipped three of our most-requested integrations. FlowSync now connects seamlessly with GitHub, Linear, and Notion.

GitHub

Sync pull requests, issues, and deployments directly to your FlowSync boards. When a PR is merged, the linked task automatically moves to "Done."

Key features:

  • Two-way sync for issues and PRs
  • Deployment status tracking
  • Branch name auto-linking

Linear

Already using Linear for issue tracking? No problem. FlowSync's Linear integration lets you view and manage Linear issues alongside your FlowSync tasks.

Key features:

  • Import Linear projects as FlowSync boards
  • Bi-directional status sync
  • Label and priority mapping

Notion

Embed Notion pages directly in FlowSync tasks, or create Notion docs from task descriptions with one click.

Key features:

  • Notion page embeds in task details
  • One-click doc creation
  • Search across both platforms

Setting Up

All three integrations are available now for Pro and Enterprise plans. Head to Settings > Integrations in your workspace to connect.

We're adding new integrations every month. Let us know which tools you'd like to see next.
